description: Divisibility, prime numbers, and modular arithmetic.

description: Set theory, logic, combinatorics, and graph theory basics.

description: Propositional logic, predicates, and logical fallacies.

name: Disaster Management
description: Understanding natural disasters, their scientific causes (e.g., earth movements, weather phenomena), and safety measures.

description: Understanding movement, different kinds of motion, speed, and distance.

description: Exploring pushes and pulls, and various types of forces like gravitational or frictional.

description: Introduction to stars and the universe.

description: Concepts of force and pressure.

name: Laws of Motion
description: Understanding concepts of motion, displacement, distance, speed, velocity, acceleration, and Newton's laws of motion with related equations.

name: Work and Energy
description: Exploring concepts of work, energy (kinetic and potential), power, the law of conservation of energy, and free fall.

name: Current Electricity
description: Learning about potential difference, conductors, insulators, electrical resistance, Ohm's law, and series/parallel connections of resistors.

description: Understanding laws of chemical combination, atoms (shape, mass, valency), molecular mass, and the concept of the mole and Avogadro's number.
subject: chemistry

name: Acids, Bases and Salts
description: Exploring Arrhenius theory, concentration, pH, neutralization, properties of acids, bases, salts, water of crystallisation, and electrolysis.

name: Classification of Plants
description: Studying the kingdom Plantae, basis for classification, and the characteristics of Thallophyta, Bryophyta, Pteridophyta, Gymnosperms, and Angiosperms.
subject: biology

name: Energy Flow in an Ecosystem
description: Understanding food chains, food webs, trophic levels, the energy pyramid, and bio-geo-chemical cycles (carbon, oxygen, nitrogen).
subject: biology

name: Useful and Harmful Microbes
description: Learning about useful microbes like Lactobacilli, Rhizobium, yeast, and harmful microbes like Clostridium and others causing diseases.
subject: biology

name: Environmental Management
description: Studying weather, climate, meteorology, solid waste management principles, and disaster management including first aid.
subject: general

name: Information Communication Technology (ICT): The new direction of progress
description: Exploring components of a computer, hardware, software, and using applications like Word and Excel for documentation and data analysis.
subject: general

name: Reflection of Light
description: Understanding mirrors (plane and spherical), image formation, terms related to spherical mirrors, magnification, and sign conventions.
subject: physics

name: Study of Sound
description: Exploring sound waves, velocity of sound, reflection, echoes, reverberation, SONAR, and the structure and function of the human ear.
subject: physics

name: Carbon : An important element
description: Studying carbon's occurrence, properties, allotropes (diamond, graphite, fullerene), hydrocarbons, carbon dioxide, methane, and biogas.
subject: chemistry

name: Substances in Common Use
description: Learning about important salts (NaCl, NaHCO3, Na2CO3), bleaching powder, crystalline salts, radioactive substances, food colours, dyes, and Teflon.
subject: chemistry

name: Life Processes in Living Organisms
description: Understanding transportation in plants (root pressure, transpiration), excretion (plants and humans), and co-ordination (plants and human nervous/endocrine systems).
subject: biology

name: Heredity and Variation
description: Exploring inheritance, chromosomes, DNA, RNA, Mendel's laws of heredity, and genetic disorders (chromosomal and monogenic).
subject: biology

name: Introduction to Biotechnology
description: Learning about tissues (animal and plant), tissue culture, agricultural biotechnology (GM crops, agritourism), animal husbandry, poultry farming, and sericulture.
subject: biology

name: Observing Space : Telescopes
description: Understanding different forms of light, types of telescopes (optical, radio, X-ray), telescopes in space (Hubble, Chandra), and ISRO's contributions.
subject: physics
